title: Properties of Skewed Distributions
question_text: Next to a large middle-class neighborhood, a piece of land was purchased by land developers to build a few high-income houses. As a result, the distribution of incomes in the area became skewed to the right. Which of the following statements is true?

choices.text: Since the middle-class neighborhood is large, the addition of a few high-income homes won't affect the mean.
Skew has no affect on the mean.
The mean will tend to the same direction as the distribution's skew.
The mean will tend to the opposite direction of the skew.
Compared to the mean, the median would not be an appropriate measure of center.
